title: 92/198/EEC: Commission Decision of 24 March 1992 authorizing the United Kingdom to permit temporarily the marketing of black medick seed not satisfying the requirements of Council Directive 66/401/EEC
header:
COMMISSION DECISION
of 24 March 1992
authorizing the United  Kingdom to permit temporarily the marketing of black medick seed not satisfying the requirements of  Council Directive 66/401/EEC
(92/198/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN  COMMUNITIES
main_body: The United Kingdom is authorized to  permit, for a period expiring on 31 August 1992, the marketing in its territory of a maximum of two  tonnes of commercial seed of black medick (Medicago lupulina L.). The official label shall state:  'Intended exclusively for the United Kingdom`.

The other Member States are hereby  authorized to permit, subject to the conditions laid down in Article 1, the marketing in their  territory of a total amount of two tonnes of commercial seed of black medick (Medicago lupulina L.)  provided that it is intended exclusively for the United Kingdom. The official label shall state:  'Intended exclusively for the United Kingdom`.

Member States shall notify the  Commission before 31 October 1992 of the quantities of seed marketing in their territory pursuant  to this Decision. The Commission shall inform the other Member States thereof.
This  Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 24 March 1992. For  the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
